body:
I work at one of those...

I often have to hide at work because anything I say could be massively offensive to someone. Eggshells, all the time.

So in our code... changing the names of black and white list on our feature flags to allow and deny just ensures that some moron won't start tweeting #cancel at us. That's why I'm encouraging everyone to do it.

Being right-libertarian, I also fully support the he/him pronoun declarations people make. It allows me to know who is a snowflake so I can avoid them and save my career from getting canceled over a misunderstanding.
body_html:

body:
Although I doubt anyone is offended other than race-hustlers and 'woke' mob tilting at windmills, the proposal here is basically that we should restructure all of society around the most fragile and retarded - to what end? It's not 'just a name change' but signs of further entryism of time-wasting socjus parasites who will no doubt come up with even more petty, nonsensical grievances in the future, much to the detriment of the productive (read: actual) engineers of the world.

body: Why do you guys care this much? It's not like the GitHub thing where they screwed up thousands of programs and tutorials. This is just a backend change that won't affect anyone. Nobody is getting cancelled, Linux has tons of changes made all the time. I love people saying this is some 1984 type thing. Because one dude who has nothing better to do changed a bunch of variable names. There are real issues out there, and yet this is what you focus on. I get that nobody asked for this, but so what. Nobody is harmed. Y'all are not only making some insane slippery slope arguments, but also completely flipping out over the smallest things. People hate SJWs for taking minor things and making them look like some massive cause that must be faught for, and ignoring real issues. Y'all are doing the same thing.
body_html: Why do you guys care this much? It's not like the GitHub thing where they screwed up thousands of programs and tutorials. This is just a backend change that won't affect anyone. post.title: Linux team approves of terminology changes and bans terms like blacklist and slave

body:
Until someone starts bitching about leader/follower because they see a dogwhistle in it. What was Hitler called again? A "Führer" aka leader?

I'm half-joking. Those people bitching about master/slave should realize **context dictates meaning**, and the context for electronic devices is not even remotely similar to the discussion of historical social and racial issues. Same deal with black/white in $foolist. 

For Torvalds it doesn't really matter. Call it "wakawaka" and "wugwug" and he'll be happy with it, as long as it's consistent, it isn't like a find and replace wouldn't get rid of most instances of that anyway.
body_html:
Until someone starts bitching about leader/follower because they see a dogwhistle in it. What was Hitler called again? A "Führer" aka leader?

I'm half-joking. Those people bitching about master/slave should realize context dictates meaning, and the context for electronic devices is not even remotely similar to the discussion of historical social and racial issues. Same deal with black/white in $foolist.

For Torvalds it doesn't really matter. Call it "wakawaka" and "wugwug" and he'll be happy with it, as long as it's consistent, it isn't like a find and replace wouldn't get rid of most instances of that anyway.

post.title: Linux team approves of terminology changes and bans terms like blacklist and slave

body:
Ok first off do you know what the definition of cancel culture is? It seems like you are just trying to use every buzz word you can think of. Nobody is being cancelled in this case. Second, I am not saying it isn't stupid. All that happened is that some person with nothing better to do changed a bunch of variable names. Then a bunch of other companies decided to change their variable names. Third, this isn't like the GitHub thing where the change actually affects anyone besides the programmers at the company. Forth, your acting like this is some malicious attack. It's just some people trying to help out a group that has been marginalised in the past, no matter how misguided. Fifth, there is a conotation to the word slave. Many people when they hear slave think of, well slavery. That is the idea behind removing that type of language. Is it really helping anyone? No, not really. But is it hurting anyone, definitely not. 
TLDR: yeah it's dumb and isn't really hurting anyone but treating it as a massive threat to free speech or what ever shows that you have spent way to much time treating every bad attempt at being progressive as some athoritarian attack on you.

No, not really. But is it hurting anyone, definitely not. TLDR: yeah it's dumb and isn't really hurting anyone but treating it as a massive threat to free speech or what ever shows that you have spent way to much time treating every bad attempt at being progressive as some athoritarian attack on you.

body:
First of all, my previous comment was in response to your goalpost shifting:

> My question is how it affects you in any way.

I think my response (and others) addresses that question quite adequately. 

---------------

> Ok first off do you know what the definition of cancel culture is?

You're missing the point - it was a hypothetical scenario, a potential concern as we descend further into this mess.

> but treating it as a massive threat to free speech 

No one said it was a "massive threat to free speech". 

>or what ever shows that you have spent way to much time treating every bad attempt at being progressive as some athoritarian attack on you

Okay, so your proposition is just "roll over and accept it"? No one is allowed to disagree with "progressive" causes? In what way should we express disapproval that would be _acceptable to you_? 

> But is it hurting anyone, definitely not.

It can certainly be argued that engineers having to waste one second of their time pointlessly renaming variables to suit the proclivities of a throng of idiots hurts them.
body_html:
First of all, my previous comment was in response to your goalpost shifting:

My question is how it affects you in any way.

I think my response (and others) addresses that question quite adequately.

Ok first off do you know what the definition of cancel culture is?

You're missing the point - it was a hypothetical scenario, a potential concern as we descend further into this mess.

but treating it as a massive threat to free speech

No one said it was a "massive threat to free speech".

or what ever shows that you have spent way to much time treating every bad attempt at being progressive as some athoritarian attack on you

Okay, so your proposition is just "roll over and accept it"? No one is allowed to disagree with "progressive" causes? In what way should we express disapproval that would be acceptable to you?

But is it hurting anyone, definitely not.

It can certainly be argued that engineers having to waste one second of their time pointlessly renaming variables to suit the proclivities of a throng of idiots hurts them.

The change is literally just changing identifier names in newly written code and words in documentation. It's not gonna affect the quality of the kernel at all.

parent.body_html:
"The Linux team has now joined many tech companies and open-source projects that have removed references to racially-charged jargon from their code for more neutral and inclusive language." "The list includes Twitter, GitHub, Microsoft, LinkedIn, Ansible, Splunk, Android, Go, MySQL, PHPUnit, Curl, OpenZFS, Rust, JP Morgan, and others"

NOT MYSQL, NOOOO
